meta.title: Cherish These Moments, Ben — 101 Call Pairing

quotes.quote:
And when the sun goes
over the same skyline —
down on the victim,
down with the 101 callers,
down with the police.

A day of going round in circles.

This is my life.
This is purpose.
Warped. Surreal. Content.

Cherish these moments, Ben.

There’s already three crime numbers under my name, all for the same thing, and now there’s another one. [...] So that’s what’s happening. Sussex Police created an extra crime number so that the IOPC can’t see their two crime numbers. That PC Dixon is hiding all the corruption.

evidence_links.summary: Ben delivers a monologue marking 1 year since his original 101 call ('Police, please'), highlighting the ongoing silence and detachment from Sussex Police.

Ben calls 101 to confirm crime numbers and demands a video call under Victims' Code. Call handler confirms PC Dixon is still the officer in charge despite non-contact since April. Ben outlines IOPC obstruction via multiple crime references and confirms systemic safeguarding failure.
